tachyon.shell.command

Class AbstractAclCommand

  • java.lang.Object
    • tachyon.shell.command.AbstractTfsShellCommand
      • tachyon.shell.command.AbstractAclCommand
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TfsShellCommand
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ChgrpCommand, ChgrpRecursiveCommand, ChmodCommand, ChmodRecursiveCommand, ChownCommand, ChownRecursiveCommand

    public abstract class AbstractAclCommand
extends AbstractTfsShellCommand
    Parent class for commands: chown, chownr, chgrp, chgrpr, chmod and chmodr.

    • Method Detail

      • chown

        protected void chown(TachyonURI path,
                     String owner,
                     boolean recursive)
              throws IOException
        Changes the owner for the directory or file with the path specified in args.
        Parameters:
        path - The TachyonURI path as the input of the command
        owner - The owner to be updated to the file or directory
        recursive - Whether change the owner recursively
        Throws:
        IOException - if command failed

      • chgrp

        protected void chgrp(TachyonURI path,
                     String group,
                     boolean recursive)
              throws IOException
        Changes the group for the directory or file with the path specified in args.
        Parameters:
        path - The TachyonURI path as the input of the command
        group - The group to be updated to the file or directory
        recursive - Whether change the group recursively
        Throws:
        IOException

      • chmod

        protected void chmod(TachyonURI path,
                     String modeStr,
                     boolean recursive)
              throws IOException
        Changes the permissions of directory or file with the path specified in args.
        Parameters:
        path - The TachyonURI path as the input of the command
        modeStr - The new permission to be updated to the file or directory
        recursive - Whether change the permission recursively
        Throws:
        IOException - if command failed
